Message.Msg: Inflation is everywhere and all times a monetary phenomenon - Milton Friedman. The increasing oil production cost does not cause inflation, what it does is siphon more and more of society's resources, and credit to finance the resources, from other areas weakening the economy. A weaker economy creates less credit and will lead to deflation as old credits are defaulted on. During the 1970s the oil price increased with little or no increase in production cost which was massively inflationary. The high profit of oil producers had to be financed somehow, and that was achieved by creating large amounts of credit - petrodollars. Oil producers are not really earnings much profit now as almost all their profit has to be spent to replace the oil they produce...
